adjective.description: Typical of a particular person, place, or thing.
examples: large farms are characteristic of this area

noun.description: A feature or quality belonging typically to a person, place, or thing and serving to identify it.
examples: inherited characteristics such as blood groups

noun.description: The whole number or integral part of a logarithm, which gives the order of magnitude of the original number.

origin: Mid 17th century: from French caractéristique or medieval Latin characteristicus, from Greek kharaktēristikos, from kharaktēr a stamping tool.
